briefTitle: Phase IIIB Subcutaneous Abatacept Monotherapy Study
officialTitle: A Phase IIIb, Multi-center, Stratified, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity, Steady State Trough Level, and Safety of Subcutaneous Abatacept (BMS-188667) in Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis Administered With or Without Background Methotrexate
summary: To evaluate safety and immunogenicity of abatacept when used with or without methotrexate in the absence of an IV loading dose of abatacept

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-abatacept or Anti-CTLA4-T Responses (Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay [ELISA] Method) at Day 113 of the ST Study
